thread.title: Real Madrid news: Sergio Ramos considers changing to No 93 | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Real Madrid news: Sergio Ramos considers changing to No 93 | Daily Mail Online

author: Tom Bassam For Mailonline
title: Real Madrid news: Sergio Ramos considers changing to No 93 | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'At the same time, the No 4 is one that I have always liked and that I have worn throughout all of my time at Real Madrid. It has nearly always brought me good luck. 'But do not rule out seeing me change my number in my final season, as a tribute to what is such a great minute for us. Real boss Zinedine Zidane oversaw training on Tuesday ahead of his side's clash with Napoli Cristiano Ronaldo took part in training at Valdebebas after missing Monday's session Although Gareth Bale has returned to training after his ankle lay-off he is not expected to play 'The Decima goal stands out above the rest of my goals, given how long we had been waiting to win the Champions League, with it coming in the last minute and because it helped us to go on and become champions.' This season Real are bidding for a 12th European title and take on Napoli in the first leg of their last 16 tie on Wednesday. Boss Zinedine Zidane oversaw training on Tuesday in Madrid, with Cristiano Ronaldo taking part after missing Monday's session. Zidane says his side are 'always favourites' in a two-legged tie but insists he will not underestimating the Italians. Real will take Bale's return slowly after the Welsh star's three month ankle injury absence Zidane says his side are 'always favourites' over two-legs but is not underestimating Napoli Although Gareth Bale has returned to training following his ankle lay-off the French coach is not expecting the Welsh star to make the first leg. 'It's only the first week he's been training with us and he doesn't have any ankle pain, that's the most important thing,' Zidane told reporters. 'We'll see when we finalise the squad list but we know that he's been out for three months and we have to take it slowly.' RELATED ARTICLES
